Create Network Profiles

A network profile includes the configuration for traffic shaping, Quality of Service (QoS), and QoS statistics collection for both uplink and downlink directions over the HNG.

An uplink QoS profile configures parameters for Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) to be applied to data traffic towards the HNG from access network devices, such as the RRH. A downlink QoS profile configures parameters for the DSCP to be applied to data traffic towards access devices from the HNG.

Traffic shaping uses a queuing discipline to categorize traffic. Egress traffic can be sorted into various queues, each with its own priority, size, rate, and latency criteria. The shaping algorithms try to limit traffic from each of these queues in order to get the best overall results. This allows optimal utilization of the egress pipe, while not choking any particular flow. Traffic can also be categorized into different classes based on various criteria. Traffic for each of these classes receives a dedicated queue, which enforces the requisite criteria for rate, latency, priority, and so on, before sending it out on the interface.

  • Configure Uplink QoS
    Use this task to configure an uplink QoS profile for Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) to be applied to data traffic towards the HNG from access network devices, such as the RRH.
  • Configure Downlink QoS
    Use this task to configure a downlink QoS profile for Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) maps to be applied to data traffic from the HNG to access network devices, such as the RRH.
  • Configure Downlink QoS Shaping
    Use this task to configure a downlink QoS profile that configures parameters for DSCP maps to be applied to data traffic towards access devices, such as an RRH from the HNG.
  • Create a Traffic Shaping Profile
    Use this task to create a traffic shaping profile necessary for categorizing uplink access network traffic.
Parent topic: Configure Device System Profiles
